item.title: OpenAI 推出处于测试阶段的 "o3 "人工智能推理模型
item.description: OpenAI 周五表示，它正在测试新的人工智能推理模型--o3 和 o3 mini，这表明它与谷歌等竞争对手的竞争日益激烈，双方都在努力创造能够解决复杂问题的更智能模型。【原文：OpenAI said on Friday it was testing new reasoning AI models, o3 and o3 mini, in a sign of growing competition with rivals such as Google to create smarter models capable of tackling complex problems.】

item.title: 独家报道新日铁在信中称白宫对注定失败的交易审查施加了不当影响
item.description: 新日铁指控白宫对其 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司的国家安全审查施加了 "不允许的不当影响"，并威胁称如果该交易受阻，将采取法律行动。【原文：Nippon Steel alleges the White House had "impermissible undue influence" over a national security review of its $14.9 billion bid for U.S. Steel and threatened legal action if the deal is blocked.】

item.title: 美国陪审团在针对高通的 Arm 案中陷入僵局，仍在商议中
item.description: 美国特拉华州联邦法院的一个陪审团周五表示，在Arm Holdings起诉高通公司的诉讼中，陪审团被要求解决的一个问题陷入僵局，但仍在审议摆在其面前的另外两个问题。【原文：A jury in U.S. federal court in Delaware on Friday said it was deadlocked on one of the questions that it has been asked to resolve in Arm Holdings' , lawsuit against Qualcomm , but is still deliberating the two other questions before it.】

item.title: 大众汽车与工会就德国工厂和工作岗位达成的协议要点
item.description: 以下是周五大众汽车与工会就该汽车制造商在德国的生产基地和工作岗位达成协议的要点。该协议是经过 70 多个小时的谈判达成的，避免了欧洲最大汽车制造商罢工的幽灵。【原文：Here are the main points of a deal struck on Friday between Volkswagen and unions on the carmaker's German sites and jobs. The agreement followed more than 70 hours of talks and averted the spectre of strikes at Europe's largest carmaker.】

item.title: 大众汽车到 2030 年将在德国裁员 35,000 多人
item.description: 大众汽车周五表示，该公司已与工会达成一致，将本着对社会负责的态度，到 2030 年在其德国生产基地裁员 35,000 多人，这将有助于实现超过 150 亿欧元（156.5 亿美元）的增效。【原文：Volkswagen on Friday said it had agreed with unions to cut more than 35,000 jobs at its German sites by 2030 in a socially responsible manner, which would help achieve more than 15 billion euros ($15.65 billion) in efficiency gains.】

item.title: 美国石油和天然气钻井平台数量连续第二周保持不变 - 贝克休斯
item.description: 能源服务公司贝克休斯（Baker Hughes）周五在其密切关注的报告中称，本周美国能源公司的石油和天然气钻井平台数量连续第二周保持不变。【原文：U.S. energy firms this week kept the number of oil and natural gas rigs unchanged for the second week in a row, energy services firm Baker Hughes said in its closely followed report on Friday.】

item.title: 美国为三星电子和德州仪器敲定高达 63.5 亿美元的芯片赔偿金
item.description: 美国商务部周五表示，将最终确定向韩国三星电子和德州仪器分别拨款 47.45 亿美元和 16.1 亿美元，用于扩大芯片生产。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department said Friday it was finalizing an award of up to $4.745 billion to South Korea's Samsung Electronics and up to $1.61 billion for Texas Instruments to expand chips production.】

item.title: TikTok 潜在竞购者物色首席执行官，准备全面改革业务
item.description: 美国亿万富翁商人弗兰克-麦考特告诉路透社，他正在对 TikTok 的商业模式进行根本性改革，作为竞购中国短视频应用计划的一部分。【原文：U.S. billionaire businessman Frank McCourt is crafting a fundamental overhaul of TikTok's business model as part of a plan to bid for the Chinese-owned short-form video app, he told Reuters.】

item.title: 行业组织称，11 月份得克萨斯州石油业上游工作岗位下滑
item.description: 德克萨斯州独立生产商和版税所有者协会（TIPRO）周五表示，上游石油公司在 11 月份减少了招聘，结束了连续五个月的就业增长。【原文：Upstream oil companies wound down hiring in November, the Texas Independent Producers and Royalty Owners Association (TIPRO) said on Friday, ending five straight months of job growth.】

item.title: 继高盛之后，富国银行又一高调撤离气候银行集团
item.description: 富国银行（Wells Fargo）退出了一个致力于遏制温室气体排放的全球银行集团，在日益增长的政治压力下，越来越多的知名企业退出了气候倡议。【原文：Wells Fargo has withdrawn from a group of global banks committed to curbing greenhouse gas emissions, increasing the number of high-profile firms exiting climate initiatives amid mounting political pressure.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比称政策不确定性导致其改变降息路径
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周五表示，他现在预计2025年的降息路径将比之前更浅，但他补充说，他仍然相信美国央行的政策利率明年将 "明智地 "下降。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee said on Friday he now projects a shallower rate-cutting path in 2025 than he had previously, but added he still believes the U.S. central bank's policy rate will fall a "judicious amount" next year.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士：美国计划将订购华为处理器中发现的台积电芯片的公司列入黑名单
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，拜登政府计划将一家中国公司列入黑名单，这家公司生产的台积电芯片被非法集成到华为的人工智能处理器中。【原文：The Biden administration plans to blacklist a Chinese company whose TSMC-made chip was illegally incorporated into a Huawei AI processor, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国机构建议简化自动驾驶汽车豁免审查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周五提出了一项新流程，以简化对汽车制造商申请豁免的审查，这些制造商希望在没有方向盘或刹车踏板等必要人机控制装置的情况下部署自动驾驶汽车。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Friday proposed a new process to streamline reviews of exemptions filed by automakers seeking to deploy self-driving vehicles without required human controls like steering wheels or brake pedals.】

item.title: 盎格鲁铜矿的诱惑可能考验必和必拓的支出决心
item.description: 两位接近此事的消息人士告诉路透社，全球最大的矿业公司必和必拓需要在英美资源集团股价的基础上至少溢价40%，才能重新提出收购要约。【原文：BHP , the world's biggest miner, would need to offer a minimum 40% premium over Anglo American's share price to make a renewed takeover bid now the rival's value has been boosted by asset sales, two sources close to the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 独家报道：能源部支持的报告称，到 2028 年，美国数据中心的用电量将增加近两倍
item.description: 路透社看到的一份由能源部支持的未公开报告显示，随着美国数据中心行业经历人工智能转型，美国数据中心的电力需求将在未来三年内增长近两倍，耗电量将高达全国电力的 12%。【原文：U.S. data center power demand could nearly triple in the next three years, and consume as much as 12% of the country's electricity, as the industry undergoes an AI transformation, according to an unpublished Department of Energy-backed report seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 特朗普将其持有的公司股份转让给可撤销信托后，特朗普传媒股价下跌
item.description: 在美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普将其持有的社交媒体公司股份转移到可撤销信托之后，特朗普媒体与科技公司的股价周五下跌了约 6%。【原文：Trump Media & Technology's shares fell about 6% on Friday after U.S. President-elect Donald Trump moved the stake he owns in the social media company to a revocable trust.】

item.title: Netflix 与国际足联达成 2027 年和 2031 年女足世界杯转播协议
item.description: 世界足球管理机构周五表示，国际足联和 Netflix 已签署协议，将在美国转播 2027 年和 2031 年两届女足世界杯。【原文：FIFA and Netflix have signed a deal to broadcast the 2027 and 2031 editions of the women's World Cup in the United States, world soccer's governing body said on Friday.】

item.title: 经理人》杂志称，未来几年大众汽车将裁员 1 万多人
item.description: 据《经理人》杂志报道，作为与工会就德国品牌未来达成的协议的一部分，大众汽车计划在未来几年内裁员 1 万多人，但未说明从何处获得这一信息。【原文：Volkswagen plans to cut more than 10,000 jobs in the next few years as part of an agreement with unions over the future of the German brand, manager magazin reported, not citing where it obtained the information.】

item.title: CFPB 起诉美国顶级银行，称其纵容支付平台 Zelle 上的欺诈行为
item.description: 美国消费者金融保护局周五表示，已对摩根大通、美国银行和富国银行提起诉讼，指控这些银行允许点对点支付平台 Zelle 上的 "欺诈行为恶化"。【原文：The U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said on Friday it had filed a lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase , Bank of America , and Wells Fargo , accusing the banks of allowing "fraud to fester" on peer-to-peer payments platform Zelle.】

item.title: 邮轮运营商嘉年华因需求强劲而收入超出预期
item.description: 嘉年华公司周五公布的第四季度营收超出预期，这主要得益于美国人渴望在夏季出游，对价格较高的航次需求旺盛，使其股价在盘前交易中上涨了约 4%。【原文：Carnival Corp beat fourth-quarter revenue estimates on Friday, helped by resilient demand for its pricier voyages from Americans eager to go on summer cruises, sending its shares up about 4% in premarket trading.】

item.title: VIEW 美国 11 月 PCE 通胀降温
item.description: 11 月份个人消费支出（PCE）物价指数增长 0.1%，低于预期，与 10 月份未经修正的 0.2% 的增幅相比，通胀形势有所降温，加之消费者支出稳健但令人失望，支撑着因美联储本周 "鹰派 "降息而苦苦挣扎的市场。【原文：The personal consumption expenditures (PCE) price index rose a less-than-expected 0.1% in November, marking a cooler inflation picture than October's unrevised 0.2% gain, and, combined with solid but disappointing consumer spending, supported markets struggling with the Federal Reserve's "hawkish' rate cut this week.】

item.title: 美联储哈马克称经济强劲反对降息
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）周五表示，她对央行本周早些时候的降息行动投了反对票，因为经济实力和通胀前景都不支持放松政策。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said Friday she voted against the central bank’s rate cut earlier this week because economic strength and the inflation outlook argued against easing policy.】

item.title: 美联储主席威廉姆斯美联储仍在减息轨道上，但前景不明朗
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周五表示，他预计央行将实施更多的降息措施，但他指出，在政策仍在抑制经济发展势头的情况下，降息措施的实施将受到新数据的驱动。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said Friday that he expects the central bank to deliver more interest rate cuts but noted what happens will be driven by incoming data, amid a policy that's still providing restraint on the economy's momentum.】

item.title: 美联储主席戴利称本周降息 "千钧一发
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）周五表示，美国央行周三再次降息四分之一个百分点的决定是一个 "千钧一发的决定"，并补充说她同意主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的观点，即现在需要对进一步的政策调整保持谨慎。【原文：San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank President Mary Daly on Friday said the decision by the U.S. central bank to lower interest rates on Wednesday by another quarter percentage point was a "close call," adding she agreed with Chair Jerome Powell that caution is now warranted toward further policy adjustments.】

item.title: 美国 11 月消费者支出增长；月度通胀率减弱
item.description: 美国消费者支出在 11 月份有所增加，凸显了经济的持久强劲，这促使美联储本周预计 2025 年的降息次数将少于三个月前。【原文：U.S. consumer spending increased in November, underscoring the economy's enduring strength, which prompted the Federal Reserve this week to project fewer interest rate cuts in 2025 than it had three months ago.】

item.title: 据《德国商报》报道，大众汽车与劳资协议会达成临时协议
item.description: 据《德国商报》周五援引熟知内情的人士的话报道，大众汽车与其劳资协议会就削减成本措施达成了临时协议，但仍需双方进一步审查并达成一致。【原文：Volkswagen and its works council reached a provisional deal on cost-cutting measures that still requires further scrutiny and agreement from both sides, Handelsblatt reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the proceedings.】

item.title: Stellantis 将菲亚特 500 工厂的停工期延长至 1 月 20 日
item.description: 汽车制造商 Stellantis 周五表示，菲亚特 500 城市电动车的停产时间将再延长几周，直至 1 月 20 日，这证实了工会的预期。【原文：Automaker Stellantis said on Friday a pause in production of its electric Fiat 500 city car will be extended by another couple of weeks until Jan. 20, confirming the expectations of trade unions.】

item.title: 前国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁拉托因腐败案被判处 4 年 9 个月监禁
item.description: 马德里一家法院周五发表声明说，国际货币基金组织前总裁罗德里戈-拉托（Rodrigo Rato）因与腐败有关的各种罪行被判处四年九个月零一天的监禁。【原文：A Madrid court has sentenced former International Monetary Fund chief Rodrigo Rato to four years, nine months and a day in prison for various crimes related to corruption, the court said in a statement on Friday.】

item.title: 全球股票基金在美联储决议前面临巨额资金外流
item.description: 截至12月18日的一周内，投资者以15年来最快的速度清算股票基金，原因是在近期市场反弹之后，投资者因预期美国联邦储备委员会（Federal Reserve）政策会议将出现鹰派结果而谨慎行事并获利了结。【原文：Investors liquidated equity funds at the fastest rate in 15 years in the week to Dec. 18, driven by caution and profit-taking in anticipation of a hawkish outcome from the U.S. Federal Reserve's policy meeting after a recent market rally.】

item.title: 美联储决议前美国股票基金出现 15 年来最大净流出
item.description: 根据理柏集团（LSEG Lipper）的数据，在截至12月18日的一周内，投资者从美国股票基金中净撤资502亿美元，这是自2009年9月以来最大的净流出量，因为他们在美联储政策决定之前兑现了市场反弹带来的利润。【原文：Investors pulled a net $50.2 billion from U.S. equity funds in the week ending Dec. 18, according to LSEG Lipper data, the biggest net outflow since Sept. 2009, as they cashed in profits from a market rally ahead of the Fed policy decision.】
